title: Heatwaves Are The Deadliest Weather Events, But They're Rarely Treated That Way
description: Heatwaves don't have names or categories like hurricanes and wildfires, but they kill more people each year than any other weather event, according to the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).
copyright: Copyright 2020-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: Heatwaves Are The Deadliest Weather Events, But They're Rarely Treated That Way
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Extreme heat is here. And it requires a mix of long term planning and emergency response.
itunes:subtitle: Extreme heat is here. And it requires a mix of long term planning and emergency response.
